title: Riot is Discussing Possible Nerfs to Warwick
body:
I don't chime in too often on league balance decisions but this is the wrong move. While Warwick sports a high Winrate and is popular he isn't nerf worthy. He fits his play style perfectly and his niche. He is an excellent duelist with hard snowball potential. 

He also has obvious weaknesses. He isn't good in team fights and Grievous wounds cripples him. He doesn't have good objective control like lee sin or nunu and all of his damage is single Target. 

I really hope they keep warwick how he is because he fits his lore and play style perfectly without being overbearing and I see no reason to think that he is over powered

replies.body:
"I see no reason to think that he is over powered"

He has a 54% win rate with a 12% play-rate, which is massive. Hes obviously overperforming.
He could use a few knocks to his base HP. He gets really tanky, really fast and deals massive damage while being such. He's extremely hard to kill before he shreds you to ribbons.

Soloing drake as a standard jungle clear is an obvious problem with warwick. - the W passive is too strong regardless of what you think.

and why isn't he good in teamfights? He's a meatshield with the potential to lock someone down, and forbid you're a jungler against him and drop to 50% health, your jungle is instantly taken away without him requiring any effort in warding/tracking you down, the W passive does it for the WW player.

Respect the fact that Warwick can solo Dragon early on, ward dragon, kill Warwick as he is taking the dragon, because he gets damned low doing so.

Dragon also gives really poor Gold/EXP, so it sets Warwick behind a fair amount untill the game actually reaches a point where that Dragon starts to matter. 
Warwick being able to solo dragon really isn't an issue.
Soloing and taking a dragon at the expense of your own gold and XP is an utterly trivial price to pay for the sheer advantage the drakes give your TEAM AS WHOLE. Team Objectives > Personal Gold/XP
*Proceeds to ignore the point that you can simply have a brain and set up vision around the area*

Vision or not, Warwick is capable of taking a dragon by himself for a team advantage. All he's got to do is wait until you gank top then go in and take the dragon. Vision means nothing if you're not there to defend the dragon when he's taking advantage of your presence on the other side of the map.
Warwick has always been able to take early drakes. Basically any damage jungler can if you play right

> [{quoted}](name=The Wolf King,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=6igORde9,comment-id=000300000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-02-12T23:06:59.010+0000)
>
> Warwick has always been able to take early drakes. Basically any damage jungler can if you play right

Problem is, he used to do it after buying a 2nd item at the very least, currently you can do with a potion and without backing.

So the enemy jungler goes Red>blue>gromp > top <> mid  || Blue > Wolves > Red > Mid<>Top  you as warwick take 3 and do dragon. Bot lane won't be  warding drake at 2:10 - 2:40 and neither will mid lane. Who would leave his lane at level 1 - 2 to try and ward/stop a double buffed jungler when he could be followed and killed in the river?

Do you randomly get level 2 in lane and go into the river to see if the double buffed jungler is nearby?

Also good luck dueling warwick as a jungler at lvl 3, at best I'd guess a shyvanna with ignite stands a chance but not anyone else.

You're something else if you think this is normal and can be countered.

This is not true of all damage junglers. Warwick is particularly unique due to his massive sustain built into his passive and Q. Most other damage junglers can't solo the dragon until much later than Warwick without risking execution.

> [{quoted}](name=Hey h0w r ya,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=6igORde9,comment-id=,timestamp=2018-02-12T20:24:45.402+0000)
>

>  He doesn't have good objective control like lee sin or nunu


?
0 clue what you mean by this

He's not picked at all in competitive for a number of reasons. His healing is very cheap to counter. His ult has a ton of counterplay (dodge it or have a teammate stand in the way, alternatively have a teammate interrupt it, use QSS). 

Why in the world would you nerf him? There are plenty of better pubstomp champions out there like Twitch that are much easier to play.
I'm saying he shouldn't be nerfed
they need to nerf that early game healing on his Q its just way to strong
I still miss the old WW.  I had lots of fun with him.  I played a ton on him pre and now I have only played him a handful of times.
